Detailed Description

GuiDevice inherits from Device and stores additional data and functions to draw, show and control the devices in the gui.

Author
Tobias Holst
Version
4.0.1

Definition at line 61 of file guidevice.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Tapi::GuiDevice::GuiDevice ( QWidget *  parent,
uint8_t  type,
std::string  name,
std::string  uuid,
unsigned long  lastSeq,
ros::Time  lastSeen,
unsigned long  heartbeat,
std::map< std::string, Feature >  features 
)

Create a GuiDevice object.

Parameters
parentParent widget of the GuiDevice, should be a pointer to the Tapi::TapiGui object
typeType of the device (tapi_lib::Device::Type_Publisher for Publisher and ServiceServer or tapi_lib::Device::Type_Subscriber for Subscriber and ServiceClients)
nameName of the device
uuidUnique ID of the device
lastSeqSequence number of the header of the device when it has been seen for the last time
lastSeenTimestamp when the device has been seen for the last time
heartbeatHeartbeat (delay the device shall wait between two Hello-calls) configured for this device
featuresMap of Tapi::Feature objects to describe the features of the device
See also
Tapi::Device in the tapi_lib package
Device.msg in the tapi_lib package

Member Function Documentation

QPoint Tapi::GuiDevice::FeatureBoxPosition ( Tapi::Feature *  feature)

Calculate the position of the feature box where the drawing of a connection has to start/end.

Parameters
featurePointer to the feature whose position has to be calculated
Returns
QPoint with x = left end of the box for type = tapi_lib::Device::Type_Publisher or x = right end of the box for type = tapi_lib::Device::Type_Subscriber), y = half of the height of this box
See also
Device.msg in the tapi_lib package
Tapi::TapiGui::paintEvent

signal

featureClicked event, emitted when a feature of this GuiDevice has been clicked

Parameters
guideviceA pointer to this GuiDevice is forwarded
featureA Pointer to the clicked Tapi::Feature is forwarded
See also
Tapi::Feature in the tapi_lib package
void Tapi::GuiDevice::mouseReleaseEvent ( QMouseEvent *  event)
protected

Track mouse clicks (or button releases, to be more precise) in the gui.

Track mouse input of the user to create new connections or delete them. When the event occurs it already means that the click happened on exactly this device object. Then the position of the event is used to calculate on which feature the click happened. Then it emits a featureClicked event where the Tapi::TapiGui object conects to.

Parameters
eventInformation about the click event like its position.
See also
Tapi::TapiGui::featureClicked

Definition at line 145 of file guidevice.cpp.

void Tapi::GuiDevice::paintEvent ( QPaintEvent *  )
protected

Overrides the paintEvent of Qt to draw the widget for this device.

It calculates the necessary size of the outer box for the device, draws thix box with round edges, writes the name of the device and the name for every feature in it and draws connection boxes to the side of the object.

Definition at line 162 of file guidevice.cpp.

QColor Tapi::GuiDevice::stringToColor ( std::string  messagetype)
static

Calculate a color from a string to create unique colors for every ros topic.

It takes the string and calculates a cryptographic hash (MD5) of it. Then the first byte of the MD5-sum is used as the value for red, the second for green and the third for blue. From this three color values a QColor object is created to color the keys per Topic in Tapi::TapiGui and the feature boxes of the GuiDevice

Parameters
messagetypeString to build the color, should be the topic type like "std_msgs/Bool"
Returns
(Hopefully) unique (if there is no hash collision) color for this string/message-type
See also
Tapi::TapiGui::checkForGuiUpdate
Tapi::GuiDevice::paintEvent

nameName of the device
lastSeqSequence number of the header of the device when it has been seen for the last time
lastSeenTimestamp when the device has been seen for the last time
heartbeatHeartbeat (delay the device shall wait between two Hello-calls) configured for this device
